Issues.Title: Need judge styles[transitionProp 'Duration'] is undefined (fix #7444)
Issues.Body:
**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one) - [x] Bugfix - [ ] Feature - [ ] Code style update - [ ] Refactor - [ ] Build-related changes - [ ] Other, please describe: **Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one) - [ ] Yes - [x] No **The PR fulfills these requirements:** - [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch - [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number) - [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup - [ ] New/updated tests are included **Other information:** `jsdom` returns `undefined` from `style` instead of empty string. ``` $ node > const jsdom = require("jsdom"); undefined > const { JSDOM } = jsdom; undefined > const dom = new JSDOM(`

Hello world

`); undefined > dom.window.document.querySelector("p").style CSSStyleDeclaration { '0': 'color', _values: { color: 'red' }, _importants: { color: '' }, _length: 1, _onChange: [Function] } > dom.window.document.querySelector("p").style.color 'red' > dom.window.document.querySelector("p").style.unexisted undefined > ``` So a solution is to do like that: ``` (styles[transitionProp + 'Delay'] || '').split(', ') ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Need judge styles[transitionProp 'Duration'] is undefined (fix #7444)" (#8281)

Issues.Title: Component name only allow first char to be uppercase

### Steps to reproduce
no special steps, change the componet name from MyTest to Mytest and <MyTest></MyTest> to <Mytest></Mytest> make it work, otherwise the componet just don't get rendered

### What is expected?
The component should be there with content 自定义组件! surrended by h1

### What is actually happening?
componet not there actually, if i change my componet name from MyTest to Mytest, the componet got rendered properly

---
I'm new to Vue so not quite sure if it is a bug or Vue component standard,

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Transition behavior is different when an uncalled done is provided in hook method
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[http://jsbin.com/wotazalama/1/edit?html,css,js,output](http://jsbin.com/wotazalama/1/edit?html,css,js,output)

### Steps to reproduce
In the demo link, click toggle to show and hide element

### What is expected?
The two boxes are configured with `<transition>`, only differs in enter and leave hook.   
One is called with `enter(el){...}` and `leave(el){ ... }` .  
The other one is called with `enter(el, done){...}` and `leave(el, done){ .... }.   
Both function do the same thing and the done callback is not called.   
It is expected that the two boxes enter and leave the same way.

### What is actually happening?
Box hooked with `enter(el, done){...}` and `leave(el, done){...}` do transition properly.  
Box hooked with `enter(el){...}` and `leave(el){...}` do not have leave transition.

---
This is a re-submit of #8275 , I have messed up that demo. This one should properly demo the case.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Transition behavior is different when an uncalled done is provided in hook method" (#8279)

Issues.Title: trouble with v-if/v-else-if ？？
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue](https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue)

### Steps to reproduce
外层for，然后子项再次for，
子项循环的时候会根据一个status来显示，所以用到v-if v-else-if v-else
然后出现的问题是v-if没问题，v-else-if/v-else都加载了两 1次，就是本来length是3，实际加载出来是7条数据

### What is expected?
正常显示

### What is actually happening?
外层for，然后子项再次for，
子项循环的时候会根据一个status来显示，所以用到v-if v-else-if v-else
然后出现的问题是v-if没问题，v-else-if/v-else都加载了两 1次，就是本来length是3，实际加载出来是7条数据

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Transition behavior is different when an uncalled done is provided in hook method
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[http://jsbin.com/gakoreyoha/edit?html,css,js,output](http://jsbin.com/gakoreyoha/edit?html,css,js,output)

### Steps to reproduce
In the demo link, click toggle to show and hide element

### What is expected?
The two boxes are configured with `<transition>` with different `enter` and `leave` hook. One is called with `leave(el){ ... }` and the other one is called with `leave(el, done){ .... }`. Both function do the same thing and the `done` callback is not called. It is expected that the two boxes enter and leave the same way.

### What is actually happening?
The box hooked `leave(el)` hook has no leave transition.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Transition behavior is different when an uncalled done is provided in hook method" (#8275)

Issues.Title: Set object is not reactive
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/86us8zxz/2/](https://jsfiddle.net/86us8zxz/2/)

### Steps to reproduce
Attach a `new Set()` object to the `data` attribute of a component and modify it by using the set's methods (add, delete, etc).

### What is expected?
Changes in the set would reflect in the rendered HTML, just like they do for arrays.

### What is actually happening?
Nothing - the change of the set isn't picked up by Vue, making this property not reactive. This is unusual because mutations of an array works as expected (see link).

### Additional notes
[https://jsfiddle.net/86us8zxz/3/](https://jsfiddle.net/86us8zxz/3/) shows that the change in the set seems to be detected (unless the reactive system of Vue works different to my understanding) as the view updates when the set is converted to an array.


<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Set object is not reactive" (#8272)

Issues.Title: Model implementation
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Hi everybody,

I would like to submit an idea in order to continue make vuejs an awesome tool.
I'm from the back end world and I started a project with vuejs some months ago to discover the javascript ecosystem. First, I was realy enthusiastic about vue and all its features but I found that something was missing: a way to declare a model/entity to represent a data object.

I don't know what you are thinking about a such feature but I think it could be a good option to add an other library (like the router, or even the cli) to guide vue developers with data manipulations and in the same way, promote best practices in this field.

Thank you to consider my proposition.

### What does the proposed API look like?
My proposition is to integrate a library to bring the M from MVC to the V from Vue of course without dealing with persistence. Or at least to guide developers to deal with this implementation. The data attribute of a Vue component could be composed of multiple models instance, because a component is not a data object itself and it shouldn't be.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Model implementation" (#8271)

Issues.Title: Issue with refs on children in element with v-for (refs are arrays on the children)
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/darkylmnx/p6rv9nyp/](https://jsfiddle.net/darkylmnx/p6rv9nyp/)

### Steps to reproduce
Just check the console

### What is expected?
Each ref to have a single DOM node since the ref is **not on an element with a v-for**

### What is actually happening?
Creates a ref with a single value in an array, which is weird since it will never contain more than one single value

---
If this is a wanted behaviour, it should be specified in the docs please, though I don't understand why it would be the wanted behaviour.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Issue with refs on children in element with v-for (refs are arrays on the children)" (#8269)

Issues.Title: Transition using js hooks always run the initial render
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/p1dthw6z/](https://jsfiddle.net/p1dthw6z/)

### Steps to reproduce
In the demo link, toggle checkbox 'odd'.

### What is expected?
When rows appeared, both inner element transition using CSS (fade) and transition using hooks (slide) should not do initial render.

### What is actually happening?
Transition using CSS do not run the initial render, as expected.
But the transition using hooks run the initial render, as if I have used `<transition appear>`, which I didn't.

---
I don't know if it is the intended behavior. If it is, I would like to know how to avoid the initial render in the hooked transition.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Transition using js hooks always run the initial render" (#8266)

Issues.Title: "$emit native events"
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Hi team,

Maybe there should be a way to let components emit caught native events.

In my case I'm writing a music player component, I want to allow users of my component to use `.native` modifier to listen native Media Events on my component, like
```vue
<music-player @play.native="handleOnPlay" />
```
We know that `.native` modifier listen to native events on the root element of the component, but in this case `<audio>` apparently can't be a root component.

There're also other common cases facing similar issue:
- A form field component providing @input.native from an internal `<input>`
- A file upload component providing @progress.native.

I know I can catch internal native events and emit a custom event like `<audio @play="e => $emit('play', e)">` then let user do `<music-player @play="handleOnPlay">`, but I just feel using `.native` directly is more intuitive.


### What does the proposed API look like?
Possible forms
- Another modifier that lets `.native` modifier listens to not only the root element
- A directive like maybe `v-emit-native` on a non-root HTML element that lets the element emit its native events to outer `.native` listeners
- An `$emit.native(e)` method on Vue instance

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""$emit native events"" (#8259)

Issues.Title: Generate errors summary, Cannot find module 'pages_index.js?v=4759969c1da21941ddd6' from 'E:\XXX'.
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/songyazhao/vue-server-renderer-bug-mini-repo](https://github.com/songyazhao/vue-server-renderer-bug-mini-repo)

### Steps to reproduce
Tips: My English is very poor, forgive me, The following part of the English description translation.

## Reproduction Step
## 复现步骤

- Step one
- 第一步
``` bash
# install dependencies
$ yarn install # Or npm install
```

- Step two
- 第二步

  *`nuxt.config.js` Add the following configuration:*

  *`nuxt.config.js` 添加配置如下：*

  ```javascript
  module.exports = {
    ...
    build: {
      filenames: {
        chunk: '[name].js?v=[chunkhash]'
      }
    }
  }
  ```

- Step three
- 第三步

  ``` bash
  # generate static project
  $ yarn generate # Or npm run generate
  ```

- Step four
- 第四步

  *An error is as follows:*

  *呈现如下错误：*

  ```bash
  Generate errors summary:

  ROUTE  /

    Error: Cannot find module 'pages_index.js?v=4759969c1da21941ddd6' from 'E:\GitRepo-Other\vue-server-renderer-bug-mini-repo'

    - sync.js:42 Function.module.exports [as sync]
      [vue-server-renderer-bug-mini-repo]/[resolve]/lib/sync.js:42:15

    - build.js:8350 r
      [vue-server-renderer-bug-mini-repo]/[vue-server-renderer]/build.js:8350:44

    - server-bundle.js:41 Function.requireEnsure [as e]
      server-bundle.js:41:25

    - server-bundle.js:2910 _47e85732
      server-bundle.js:2910:45

    - server-bundle.js:221 __WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_1_E_GitRepo_Other_vue_server_renderer_bug_mini_repo_node_modules_babel_runtime_core_js_promise___default.a.all.flatMapComponents
      server-bundle.js:221:25

    - server-bundle.js:212
      server-bundle.js:212:14

    - Array.map

    - server-bundle.js:211
      server-bundle.js:211:163

    - Array.map

    - server-bundle.js:210 flatMapComponents
      server-bundle.js:210:57

    - server-bundle.js:218 resolveRouteComponents
      server-bundle.js:218:147

    - server-bundle.js:229 getRouteData
      server-bundle.js:229:9

    - server-bundle.js:309 setContext
      server-bundle.js:309:48

    - server-bundle.js:1609 createApp
      server-bundle.js:1609:76

    - server-bundle.js:1284 module.exports.__webpack_exports__.default
      server-bundle.js:1284:100

    - build.js:8446
      [vue-server-renderer-bug-mini-repo]/[vue-server-renderer]/build.js:8446:15
  ```

## Bug tracking
## Bug 追溯

  *` nuxt.Js ` the configuration above will generate related ` webpack ` configuration is as follows:*

  *` nuxt.js ` 的上述配置会生成相关的 `webpack` 配置如下：*

  ```javascript
  module.exports = {
  ...
    output: {
      ...
      chunkFilename: '[name].js?v=[chunkhash]'
    }
  ...
  }
  ```

  *Locating the problem:*

  *最终定位到问题：*

  > vue-server-renderer/server-plugin.js:78

  ```javascript
  if (asset.name.match(/\.js$/)) {
    ...
  }
  ```

  *Modified to:*

  *修改为：*

  ```javascript
  if (isJS(asset.name)) {
    ...
  }
  ```

  *Can solve this problem, but I don't know his judgment changed here will not affect other places*

  *可以解决这个问题，但是我不知道他这里的判断改了会不会对其他地方产生影响*


### What is expected?
Compile successfully. No error.

### What is actually happening?
 Error: Cannot find module 'pages_index.js?v=4759969c1da21941ddd6' from 'E:\GitRepo-Other\vue-server-renderer-bug-mini-repo'

---
use nuxt.js  `yarn generate`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Generate errors summary, Cannot find module 'pages_index.js?v=4759969c1da21941ddd6' from 'E:\XXX'." (#8256)

Issues.Title: how do slove this problem
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.

中文用户请注意：
请使用上面的链接来创建新的 issue。如果不是用上述工具创建的 issue 会被自动关闭。
-->
No parser and no file path given, couldn't infer a parser.

Issues.Title: When using props as initial data, child data does not update when prop is modified by parent
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/darylp/xcg9qvtr/](https://jsfiddle.net/darylp/xcg9qvtr/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open fiddle
2. Click "Update" button

### What is expected?
The child component should set it's `data.msg` to the value of the *prop* `defaultMsg` as documented here: https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components-props.html#One-Way-Data-Flow

The child component should render: "Message: Hello World"

### What is actually happening?
The `defaultMsg` prop is passed in to the child component correctly, but `data.msg` is not updated.

The child component renders: "Message: "

---
I ran into this issue while fetching data from an API to update the parent component's data. The parent's data is passed down to the child as a prop to be used as an initial value, which can then be changed within the child component.

Passing in data right away (e.g. Not using an API) works properly, as does displaying the prop in the child directly (not using the child components `data`)

This issue only occurs when using a prop as an initial value for the child's data, and updating the prop from the parent after the child has mounted.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "When using props as initial data, child data does not update when prop is modified by parent" (#8254)

Issues.Title: Regexp path yields error: `TypeError: t.replace is not a function`
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/anon/pen/Qxwvzr](https://codepen.io/anon/pen/Qxwvzr)

### Steps to reproduce
Set the path property of a route to a RegExp.

### What is expected?
According to the [docs](https://router.vuejs.org/guide/essentials/dynamic-matching.html#advanced-matching-patterns), that RegExp should be used for route matching:

> vue-router uses path-to-regexp as its path matching engine, so it supports [...] even custom regex patterns.

### What is actually happening?
A TypeError is thrown: `TypeError: t.replace is not a function`

---
~I need to use a RegExp here because I need to have a single case-sensitive route.~
Wrong: There is the `caseSensitive` option for routes.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Regexp path yields error: `TypeError: t.replace is not a function`" (#2234)

Issues.Title: Function isObjectEqual (a, b) can return unexpected result if object a has properties with undefined values
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/mburmistrov/pen/vrYWWR?editors=1112](https://codepen.io/mburmistrov/pen/vrYWWR?editors=1112)

### Steps to reproduce
Look at the codepen snippet.

It contains **isObjectEqual(a, b)** implementation from *vue-router/src/util/route.js* and an example of it's unexpected behaviour.

Console output represents the issue.

### What is expected?
In the codepen **isObjectEqual(a, b)** is used on two objects: 

```a: { foo: true, bar: undefined } ```

```b: { foo: true, baz: 'qux' } ```

What is expected: 
1. **isObjectEqual(a, b)** is expected to return false since **Object b** has 'baz' property with 'qux' value and **Object a**  doesn't have such property at all.

2. **isObjectEqual(b, a)** is expected to return false for the same reason.

3. **isObjectEqual(a, b)** result should be equal to **isObjectEqual (b, a)** result.

### What is actually happening?
What is happening:
1. **isObjectEqual(a, b)** returns true (unexpected).

2. **isObjectEqual(b, a)** returns false (expected).  

3. **isObjectEqual(a, b)** result is not equal to **isObjectEqual(b, a)** result  (unexpected).

Same thing will happen with any **Object a** and **Object b** if conditions below are met:

- **Object a** and **Object b** have the same amount of properties.

- **Object b** must have same properties with same values that are present in **Object a** with values different from undefined.


---
Issue with **isObjectEqual** causes issues with other functions that use it.

For example, **isSameRoute(a, b)** (from *vue-router/src/util/route.js*) can return true for routes with different query objects (if query objects meet conditions listed above).  

I ran into this bug because sometimes programmatic navigation worked in unexpected ways when using **router.push** with a query object.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Function isObjectEqual (a, b) can return unexpected result if object a has properties with undefined values" (#2233)

Issues.Title: digits in route don't properly match in vue-router but match in path-to-regexp
Issues.Body:

### Reproduction link

### Steps to reproduce
Create Vue
Create Router with one path using this pattern: '/*-\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2}'

### What is expected?
router pattern  '/*-\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2}' should match e.g. /test/name-2016-12-04 or /whatever/item/name-2014-03-02

### What is actually happening?
Route does not match pattern.

It seems like the vue path can't handle the curly brackets for quantifying digits. Which is weird because path-to-regexp can.

Issues.Title: 路由跳转后 params 丢失
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://icoding.so](http://icoding.so)

### Steps to reproduce


我的路由配置如下

const routes = [{
  path: '/article',
  // name: 'app.article',
  component: require('../views/Article/Article').default,
  children: [
    {
      path: 'tag/:label',
      name: 'app.article.tag',
      component: require('../views/Article/List').default,
    }
]
}];

router-link 如下

          <router-link v-if="item.name" v-for="item in tags" :key="item.id" :to="{name: 'app.article.tag', params: {label: item.name}}">{{ item.name }}</router-link>

tags 数据如下:
[{"id":1,"name":"sed","created_at":"2016-08-08 22:35:39","updated_at":"2016-08-09 02:47:56","deleted_at":null},{"id":2,"name":"linux","created_at":"2016-08-08 22:35:44","updated_at":"2016-08-09 02:47:56","deleted_at":null},{"id":3,"name":"https","created_at":"2016-08-09 00:54:18","updated_at":"2016-08-09 02:47:56","deleted_at":null},{"id":4,"name":"ssl","created_at":"2016-08-09 02:47:56","updated_at":"2016-08-09 02:47:56","deleted_at":null}]

错误的行为是， 点击其他 tag 的链接后 当前链接 url 变成  #/ . router-link 组件上的 to.params 被清空。

### What is expected?
unknow

### What is actually happening?
错误的行为是， 点击其他 tag 的链接后 当前链接 url 变成  #/ . router-link 组件上的 to.params 被清空。

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Decoding a url with & fails
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/oa2muvbo/2/](https://jsfiddle.net/oa2muvbo/2/)

### Steps to reproduce
This is not reproducible with jsfiddle... I can't really pass query params and it doesn't reproduce when hardcoded as a vuew-router link.
The url http://site.com?a=b&c=d is not properly decoded using the vue router. This only reproduces when coming from outside the application, links from inside the SPA don't have this issue.

The bug is here: vue-router/src/util/query.js Line 46
The url should be decoded before splitting it by '&'.


### What is expected?
The url http://site.com?a=b&c=d should be processed by the vue router and the query params extracted. For instance:
a=b
c=d

### What is actually happening?
Result is:
a=b
amp;c=d

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Decoding a url with & fails" (#2216)

Issues.Title: Decoding url with & fails
Issues.Body:
The url `http://site.com?a=b&c=d` is not properly decoded using the vue router. 

The bug is here: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/9bd8f3c73b5035248ceca80ca4073e6bfa22b05d/src/util/query.js#L46

The url should be decoded before splitting it by '&'.

Issues.Title: Router Link Context Menu
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
# Background

Currently, there is a lack of right-click context menu for Router Links. This would be a great addition to vue-router, router link elements.

The following points are cited from the vue-router documents: 
>It works the same way in both HTML5 history mode and hash mode, so if you ever decide to switch mode, or when the router falls back to hash mode in IE9, nothing needs to be changed.

>In HTML5 history mode, router-link will intercept the click event so that the browser doesn't try to reload the page.

>When you are using the base option in HTML5 history mode, you don't need to include it in to prop's URLs.

However, there are cases where the user may wish to open a router-link in a new window, in order to maximize productivity. For example, our team is currently rebuilding an internal campaign management system. There are several sections to this, which can be viewed simultaneously by our end users. The users prefer the option to open multiple tabs, in order to see sets of data side-by-side. 

At present, there is no context menu associated with view router links--right-clicks open the standard browser context menu. This prevents offering the user the *option* to navigate to a link in a new tab. 

# Proposal

Add an optional context menu feature to router-link elements. The feature would include the following: 
- mimic browser's native right-click context menu for anchor tags
- open a router-link using the `target=_blank` method, when option selected by user from context menu
- open router-links in same tab by default
- optional: only include the context menu if a property is set to true within the code (TBD) 



### What does the proposed API look like?
`<router-link to="/my-route" has-context-menu="true"></router-link>`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Router Link Context Menu" (#2207)

Issues.Title: $router.push encodes special characters
Issues.Body: If I write the following code `$router.push({query: {q: 'sort(desc)'}})` then in the browser url the following string is displayed: `?q=sort%28desc%29`. Is it possible to make the `push` method not encode special characters?

Issues.Title: Syntactic sugar for commiting mutations
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Committing mutations has a very strange syntax, which really stands out negatively, compared to the otherwise very elegant APIs found in the Vue/Vuex ecosystem:

    this.$store.commit('someMutation', args...)

The docs mention that this is to emphasize that a commit is not a direct call to the mutation. I don't think this line of reasoning holds in the Vue/Vuex world. In almost all other aspects of Vue/Vuex, the API looks straight forward (e.g. just getting and setting properties), but under the hood a lot of additional logic runs (dependency tracking, etc.). So there is really no need to make committing mutations more cumbersome than they need to be.

In addition to making the code harder to read, this leads to additional rules about argument passing.

Moreover, it is very hard to spot typos in the mutation name early on, as the mutation name is just a string - let alone checking that the call to `commit()` received the correct arguments according to the mutation function. These types of errors should be easy to spot at compile time, but with the current syntax, these are all pushed into runtime.

Finally, this cumbersome syntax might be (correctly) perceived as boilerplate, especially to beginners. Hence, replacing the commit syntax with a more straight forward syntax might improve the adoption of Vuex.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Instead of:

    this.$store.commit('someMutation', args...)

one should be allowed to write:

    this.$store.someMutation(args...)

Moreover, it would be great if looking at `this.$store` in the developer console all available mutation methods are shown. That is, the methods should be real properties of this.$store, collected once at program start.

Under the hood, of course, these methods might all call some central commit() function.

Alternative syntax: The above syntax might introduce some name collisions. For example, someone might name one of their mutations "state", for whatever reason, making "this.$store.state" ambiguous. For the sake of simplicity, these names should just be forbidden as mutation names. But if this is not an option for whatever reason, an intermediate object might do the trick as well. This would be less beautiful, but still better than what we have today:

    this.$store.commit.someMutation(args...)

or shorter:

    this.$store.c.someMutation(args...)

As an additional proposal, the old `this.$store.commit()` syntax should be marked deprecated.  And removed in future Vuex versions. This generic call is not needed. Any generic commit call might as well be formulated as `this.$store[mutationName](args...)`, which is still easy to understand and even shorter than `this.$store.commit(mutationName, args...)`.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Syntactic sugar for commiting mutations" (#1281)

Issues.Title: fix a broken link

Issues.Title: Many Google links returning 404s after conversion
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://vuex.vuejs.org/modules.html](https://vuex.vuejs.org/modules.html)

### Steps to reproduce
Try to visit any of the old URLs, or search Google for vuex topics and try to click through to the guide.  You will get 404s.

### What is expected?
301 redirects are in place so that users attempting to get help get to the right place.

### What is actually happening?
After the conversion to Vuepress it looks like the URL format changed from `vuex.vuejs.org/**.html` to `vuex.vuejs.org/guide/**.html`.  Google has not updated their listings, and many Stackoverflow posts will never update theirs.  As is, many users trying to get help will get frustrated and may give up altogether.

This can be solved quite easily by installing some 301 redirects on the server.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: [docs] incompatible with vuepress
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/Jinjiang/vuex/tree/vuepress](https://github.com/Jinjiang/vuex/tree/vuepress)

### Steps to reproduce
npm run docs

### What is expected?
Just try vuepress to dev/build docs

preview: https://5b01b3bb3672df726f83886e--objective-stonebraker-ca8353.netlify.com

### What is actually happening?
There always be some errors, until I changed some dev deps:

1. remove `rollup-plugin-buble`
2. remove (or upgrade v3 -> v4) `webpack`

by https://github.com/Jinjiang/vuex/commit/b74690d08cb43bff4eaa2031553e004922d802e2

But if I changed them, it failed with other npm scripts.

---
vuepress error branch:
[https://github.com/Jinjiang/vuex/tree/test](https://github.com/Jinjiang/vuex/tree/test)

vuepress error message:

```bash
> vuepress dev docs

Extracting site metadata...TypeError: Cannot destructure property `createHash` of 'undefined' or 'null'.
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/xxxxxxxx/vuex/node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/index.js:26:44)
    at Module._compile (module.js:641:30)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:652:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:560:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:503:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:495:3)
    at Module.require (module.js:585:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:11:18)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/xxxxxxxx/vuex/node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/cjs.js:3:18)
    at Module._compile (module.js:641:30)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:652:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:560:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:503:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:495:3)
    at Module.require (module.js:585:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:11:18)
```

I guess this should be considered as a bug of vuepress or we can do something in Vuex repo to walk around.

Thanks.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[docs] incompatible with vuepress" (#1275)

I only preserved English and Chinese versions. Other languages are moved to `docs-gitbook` folder temporarily. If any language is good to use vuepress too, it can be done with the folder.

Additionally, this PR has:

Thanks.

Issues.Title: The TypeScript definition files incorrectly specifies the map* functions as named exports.
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/ciddan/vuex-ts-issue](https://github.com/ciddan/vuex-ts-issue)

### Steps to reproduce
Reproduction of an issue with the TypeScript type definitions in Vuex.

1. Clone the provided repository.
2. run npm install
3. run npm start
4. Open browser and go to http://localhost:8080.
5. Open dev tools and look at the console output.


### What is expected?
That the first log output: ```mapActions from: import { mapActions } undefined``` isn't undefined.

### What is actually happening?
mapActions is undefined.

---
Please read the README in the linked repository for full information on the issue.

We ran into this issue while working on TypeScript decorators that required the use of the various map functions.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The TypeScript definition files incorrectly specifies the map* functions as named exports." (#1274)

Issues.Title: The TypeScript definition files incorrectly specifies the map* functions as named exports
Issues.Body:
This is incorrect:
https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/4d573e9960f8cca33fdf9051521a203b03b18ae5/types/index.d.ts#L6

Looking at vuex.js and vuex.common.js all of these functions are exported in the default export, not as named exports. This breaks our TypeScript/SystemJS project - since the TypeScript type of the default export only contains Store and install. Importing the map functions as named exports, i.e:
``` typescript
import { mapActions } from "vuex";
```
doesn't work either - since they're undefined at run time (SystemJS handles default and named exports differently). 

With "system" as the module format defined in tsconfig.json usage of a a named export is compiled to:
``` javascript
vuex_1.mapActions
```
Whereas usage of a default export is compiled to:
``` javascript
vuex_1.default.Store
```

The map functions should be exported together with Store and install here:
https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/4d573e9960f8cca33fdf9051521a203b03b18ae5/types/index.d.ts#L129-L132

For reference, this is the export from vuex.js:
https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/4d573e9960f8cca33fdf9051521a203b03b18ae5/dist/vuex.js#L925-L936
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The TypeScript definition files incorrectly specifies the map* functions as named exports" (#1273)

Issues.Title: 希望有一个可以获取vuxe中action是否进行中状态的插件
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
action基本是处理异步业务的。loading的状态是很重要的。
我现在的做法是在每个action中都设置一个isLoading的state
但是我希望 每个action在开始时候在全局的isLoading的action的map里面注册一下loading的状态，
在走完最后一个next后再注销一下。
我通过查询这个action的map就可以知道对应的action的状态
而不用去手动注册好多的isLoading的state 


### What does the proposed API look like?
`vue.use(vuxeLoading);

const {someActionLoadingState} = vue.vuxeLoading;

console.log(someActionLoadingState) // true or false`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "希望有一个可以获取vuxe中action是否进行中状态的插件" (#1266)
